subject: Education
title: From Radio to Zoom: A Century of EdTech
description: Learn From Radio to Zoom: A Century of EdTech in one minute.

hook.text: In the 1920s, experts predicted radio would replace teachers. Sound familiar?

buildup.text: Every generation gets a 'this technology will revolutionize education' promise.

discovery.text: Radio, TV, film, computers, and the internet each promised transformationâ€”and each partially delivered.

twist.text: The technology changed, but the hype cycle repeated identically every single time.

climax.text: The pattern: excitement, adoption, disappointment, then quiet integration into normal practice.

punchline.text: Technology never replaces teaching. It just gives teaching new tools.

quiz.question: What pattern has repeated with every new educational technology?
options: Excitement, adoption, disappointment, then quiet integration
Immediate universal adoption and permanent transformation
Rejection by all teachers and eventual abandonment
